chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody R Demarr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Per C-31. Joint and several with co-defendant. Court orders any funds that are earned in prison, not gifts, be applied towards restitution.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with the victim, Elizabeth Adams or the Rice Lake Dairy Queen.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must participate in Victim - Offender Conference through Restorative Justice that may include the victim.
12/15/15 CORRECTED TO ADD MUST SUBMIT DNA SAMPLE AND PAY THE SURCHARGE.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody R Demarr in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Cody R Demarr in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Liptak makes corrections to PSI.  State files VIS.  3:34 Argument by State 3:40 Argument by Attorney Liptak 3:52 Defendant relates 3:55 Court relates and orders:

Total length of sentence 15 years 0 months
Initial confinement 8 years 0 months
Extended supervision 7 years 0 months
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Dodge Correctional
Credit for 275 days

Conditions:
Must have no contact with the victim, Elizabeth Adams, or the Rice Lake Dairy Queen
Restitution $1,024.95 - Joint and several with co-defendant - Court orders any funds that are earned at the prison, not gifts, to be applied toward restitution
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Must participate in Victim-Offender Conference through Restorative Justice that may include the victim

Voting rights and firearm warning given.  WEDS given.
10/26/15 Letter to Judge Babler from Attorney Liptak requesting the sentencing hearing be rescheduled.

Defendant Cody R Demarr in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Cody R Demarr in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Liptak requests reset. State does not object. Reset. 

JAIL FAXED.

Defendant Cody R Demarr in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Cody R Demarr in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Information was received previously. Not guilty pleas entered.

Parties have reached an agreement. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders a PSI.
Bond revoked.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
JAIL FAXED
The minutes on 4/29/15 were changed from arraignment to other in court activity as a plea was not actually entered due to substitution of judge request.
